intro: Antirrhinum craniolare, commonly known as the skullcap antirrhinum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Plantaginaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of showy, two-lipped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and northern Africa. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Antirrhinum craniolare is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
